intro: Rorippa edirnensis, commonly known as the Edirnensis watercress, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in moist or aquatic environments such as wet meadows and marshes. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-rich water. Due to its ecological importance, it is sometimes used in wetland restoration projects.
